title: Elderly Fall With Suspected Pelvic Fracture

title: Diabetic Ketoacidosis in a Public Washroom
scenarioIntro: The call comes in from a local shopping plaza â€” a janitor reports a young adult unresponsive in a locked public washroom stall.

protocolNotes: Per ALS PCS: Naloxone indicated for suspected opioid toxicity with hypoventilation or apnea. Must initiate BVM support first. Per BLS PCS: oxygen required with SpOâ‚‚ <94% and poor respiratory effort.

clinicalReasoning: Opioids suppress respiratory drive â€” leading to hypercapnic respiratory failure. Bradypnea, low SpOâ‚‚, high ETCOâ‚‚, and pinpoint pupils point to opioid toxidrome. BVM should precede naloxone to avoid delay in oxygenation.
